hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Said ibn Jubayr: Regarding the verse 'It grants its produce in every season by the permission of its Lord' (Surah Ibrahim 25), he said: This means every six months.

chainIssues: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn is of uncertain reliability (Majhul al-Hal)
Ibrahim ibn Fahd has weakness in memory (Saduq Lahu Awham)
Ata' ibn al-Sa'ib is a mudallis (category 2) and uses indirect transmission term 'an (عَنْ) - this requires direct transmission terms for his narrations to be fully accepted
Transmission shifts from direct terms (حدثنا/نا) in the early chain to indirect terms (عَنْ) with Ata' and Said ibn Jubayr

potential_issues.issue: Primary narrator (Muhammad ibn al-Husayn) has uncertain reliability status
potential_issues.impact: This affects the overall reliability of the chain, as the collector is not well-established in hadith literature

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim ibn Fahd has documented weakness in memory (Saduq Lahu Awham)
potential_issues.impact: This introduces potential for errors in transmission, though he is still accepted as a narrator

potential_issues.issue: Ata' ibn al-Sa'ib is known for tadlis (mixing of reporters) - category 2 mudallis
potential_issues.impact: While Ata' is generally reliable (Thiqah), his use of indirect transmission term 'an (عَنْ) with his teachers requires careful evaluation. This does not necessarily invalidate the hadith but introduces a level of caution

potential_issues.issue: Data integrity: The text mentions 'Warqaa' but narrator 8149 is identified as 'Marwan ibn Uthman' - possible corruption or scribal error
potential_issues.impact: May affect accurate identification of the actual narrator in the chain

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurairah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ recited this verse: 'Allah will keep firm those who believe with the firm word in this worldly life and in the Hereafter' (Surah Ibrahim 27). He said: That is when it is said to him in the grave: What is your Lord? What is your deen (faith)? Who is your Prophet? So he will say: Allah is my Lord, Islam is my deen, and my Prophet is Muhammad. He came to us with clear signs from Allah, so I believed in him and I confirmed (him). So it will be said: You have spoken the truth. On this you lived, on this you died, and on this you will be resurrected.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abi Najih, from Mujahid: Regarding the verse 'They changed the blessing of Allah for disbelief' (Surah Ibrahim 28), the blessing of Allah is Muhammad and faith, they changed it for disbelief, and these are the disbelievers of the Quraysh at Badr.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: If Abraham the Friend of the Merciful had said: Make the hearts of the people incline towards them, then Jews and Christians would have performed pilgrimage to them. But he said: Make hearts of some people incline towards them, thus he specified the believers.
